author: Staff Reporter
text:
Former DMK Minister N. Suresh Rajan has accused officials of violating the model code of conduct (MCC) by inviting and opening tenders for awarding contract to develop a land owned by the Tamil Nadu Tourism Development Corporation (TTDC) in Kanyakumari .

Speaking to The Hindu here on Thursday, Mr. Suresh Rajan said that the officials of the TTDC had floated a tender by publishing an advertisement in a local newspaper and opened it on March 9, in violation of the MCC.

If the Election Commission of India did not take any action against the officials concerned, the DMK would approach the court, he said.

Complaint received

Kanyakumari Collector Sajjansingh R. Chavan said that a complaint had been received in this regard on Thursday afternoon.

It had been forwarded to the Returning Officer of Kanyakumari constituency P. Chinnammal.

If there was any violation of Model Code of Conduct, action would be initiated against officials, said the Collector.
title: DMK alleges code violation by officials
